v8:item.v8:content: Change the application name, configure additional attributes, and other general settings.
Use these addresses to generate links to infobase objects if the infobase is published on the Internet or in the local network.
Use this address to generate objects links if the infobase is published on the Internet.
Use this address to generate objects links if the infobase is published in the local network.
Configure proxy server parameters on the 1C:Enterprise server.
Cannot configure proxy server on the server when using security profiles
Cannot configure proxy server on the server when using security profiles decoration

Cannot configure Internet access parameters on the 1C:Enterprise server as the infobase uses security profiles. With security profiles enabled, you can configure Internet access parameters on the 1C:Enterprise server only by editing the inetcfg.xml file (for more information, see 1C:Enterprise Administrator Guide).
Classify addresses, phones, and other contact information of application objects, such as partners, counterparties, or employees.
Create and configure additional text, numeric, and other properties for your application objects such as catalogs or documents.

Additional information records are edited in a separate form opened from a catalog or a document. You can set up rights to edit and view the additional information records regardless of the rights to an owner object.
Additional attributes are placed in document and catalog forms as fields. To edit and view the additional attributes, you need to have the required rights to an owner object.
Use labels to mark catalogs and documents with multi-colored label icons. To edit and view the labels, you need to have the required rights to an owner object.
Store and view document and catalog versions.
Configure search in documents, files, and reports.
Allows digital signatures to guarantee that data remains unmodified and data encryption to secure access restrictions.
Certificates and digital signature and encryption applications
Configure certificates and applications used for signing and encryption.
In the web application, you can select types of signatures with timestamps when signing by a certificate installed on the computer that also has a digital signature application installed.
In SaaS mode, the archival timestamp is unavailable by default. You can select this signature type when signing by a certificate installed by a digital signing app.
To create electronic signatures with time, specify timestamp server addresses (on a new line). The addresses can be provided by a service provider, for example, a certificate authority.

To ensure that signature validity is maintained automatically using a scheduled job, a <link Programs>digital signature application</> must be installed on each computer running 1C:Enterprise server or the web server connected to the file infobase.
Enhance signatures up to the selected type
* Using commands in the <link ReportOnRenewalOfSignatures>report</> and the "To-do list" panel.
Starting from the signature creation date
New timestamps will be added to archival electronic signatures (CAdES-A) a month before timestamp signature certificate expires.
Allows verifying digital signatures and certificates without installing a digital signing app on the user's computer.
Allows encryption decryption, and signing without installing a digital signing app and a certificate on the user's computer.
If you expect to use advanced qualified digital signatures, install a certified data encryption tool. <link CheckCryptographyAppsInstallation>Click to install</>
Configure DSS servers used to establish connection.
Configure accounts used to connect to DSS and to perform operations.
Open workspace for deleting marked objects.
More threads lead to faster execution of long-running operations (such as importing address classifiers). The default value is "4".
Recommended value: • 50%–75% of the cores available cores to the cluster. • For faster execution during low user activity periods, up to 100% of the cores available to the cluster.
Temporary file directory of 1C:Enterprise server cluster
Paths of temporary server cluster directories
For multithreaded long-running operations, a path to a network directory for temporary files of all 1C:Enterprise servers running in a single cluster.
Starting from the signature creation date
Security profile options to control how the app uses resources external to the 1C:Enterprise server cluster.
